24:I[78891,["529","static/chunks/529-b3a318fab494e03f.js","244","static/chunks/244-f8e89f92ed6eb924.js","839","static/chunks/839-b514104c7e948606.js","165","static/chunks/165-ae3b45f0d86ef78d.js","184","static/chunks/app/dashboard/roots/%5Broot%5D/page-e0a9e2c37c8cb20d.js"],"CardTitle"]
25:T4dc,You who believe, when you contract a debt for a stated term, put it down in writing: have a scribe write it down justly between you. No scribe should refuse to write: let him write as God has taught him, let the debtor dictate, and let him fear God, his Lord, and not diminish &#91;the debt&#93; at all. If the debtor is feeble-minded, weak, or unable to dictate, then let his guardian dictate justly. Call in two men as witnesses. If two men are not there, then call one man and two women out of those you approve as witnesses, so that if one of the two women should forget the other can remind her. Let the witnesses not refuse when they are summoned. Do not disdain to write the debt down, be it small or large, along with the time it falls due: this way is more equitable in God&rsquo;s eyes, more reliable as testimony, and more likely to prevent doubts arising between you. But if the merchandise is there and you hand it over, there is no blame on you if you do not write it down. Have witnesses present whenever you trade with one another, and let no harm be done to either scribe or witness, for if you did cause them harm, it would be a crime on your part. Be mindful of God, and He will teach you: He has full knowledge of everything26:T2a97,<entryFree id="n1255" key="أَمِنَ" type="main">     
                  <form>       
                     <itype>1</itype>        
                     <orth orig="" extent="full" lang="ar">أَمِنَ</orth>
                     <orth extent="full" lang="ar">ذ</orth>
                  </form>, (T, S, M, &amp;c.,) aor.      
    <form n="infl">       
                     <orth orig="Ba" lang="ar">اَمَنَ</orth>
                  </form>, (T, Msb, K,) inf. n. <foreign lang="ar">أَمْنٌ</foreign> (T, S, M, Msb, K) and <foreign lang="ar">إِمْنٌ</foreign> (Zj, M, K) and <foreign lang="ar">أَمَنٌ</foreign> (M, K) and <foreign lang="ar">أَمَنَةٌ</foreign> (T, S, M, K) and <foreign lang="ar">إِمْنَةٌ</foreign> (T) and <foreign lang="ar">أَمَانٌ</foreign> (M, K) [and app. <foreign lang="ar">أَمَانَةٌ</foreign>, for it is said in the S that this is syn. with <foreign lang="ar">أَمَانٌ</foreign>,] and <foreign lang="ar">آمنٌ</foreign>, an instance of an inf. n. of the measure <foreign lang="ar">فَاعِلٌ</foreign>, which is strange, (MF,) or this is a subst. like <foreign lang="ar">فَالِجٌ</foreign>, (M,) <hi rend="ital">He was,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">became,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">felt, secure, safe,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in a state of security</hi> or <hi rend="ital">safety;</hi> originally, <hi rend="ital">he was,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">became, quiet,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tranquil, in heart,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mind;</hi> (Msb;) <hi rend="ital">he was,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">became, secure,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">free from fear;</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">أَمْنٌ</foreign> signifying the <hi rend="ital">contr. of</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">خَوْفٌ</foreign>, (S, M, K,) and so <foreign lang="ar">أَمَنَةٌ</foreign> (S) and <foreign lang="ar">آمِنٌ</foreign> [&amp;c.]: (M, K:) <hi rend="ital">he was,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">became,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">felt, free from expectation of evil,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">of an object of dislike</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hatred, in the coming time;</hi> originally, <hi rend="ital">he was,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">became, easy in mind, and free from fear.</hi> (El-Munáwee, TA.) [See <foreign lang="ar">أَمْنٌ</foreign>, below.] You say also, <foreign lang="ar">يَإْمَنُ عَلَى نَفْسِهِ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">He is secure,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">safe,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">free from fear, for himself</hi>]. (M.) And <foreign lang="ar">أَمِنَ البَلَدُ</foreign>, meaning <hi rend="ital">The inhabitants of the country</hi> or <hi rend="ital">district,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">town, were in a state of security,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">confidence, therein.</hi> (Msb.) The verb is trans. by itself, and by means of the particle <foreign lang="ar">مِنْ</foreign>; as in <foreign lang="ar">أَمَنَ زَيْدٌ الأَسَدَ</foreign> and <foreign lang="ar">أَمِنَ مِنَ</foreign> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">الأَسَدِ</foreign>, meaning <hi rend="ital">Zeyd was,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">became,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">felt, secure from, safe from,</hi> [or <hi rend="ital">free from fear of,</hi>] <hi rend="ital">the lion.</hi> (Msb.) You say also, <foreign lang="ar">أَمِنَ كَذِبَ مَنْ</foreign> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">أَخْبَرَهُ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">He was secure from,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">free from fear of, the lying of him who informed him</hi>]. (M.) And <foreign lang="ar">لَا آنَنُ أَنْ يَكُونَ كَذلِكَ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">I am not free from fear of its being so; I am not sure but that it may be so</hi>]. (Mgh in art. <foreign lang="ar">نبذ</foreign>; and other lexicons passim.) And, of a strong-made she camel, <foreign lang="ar">أَمِنَتْ</foreign> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">أَنْ تَكُونَ ضَعَيفَةً</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">She was secure from,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">free from fear of, being weak</hi>]: (M: [in a copy of the S <foreign lang="ar">أُمِنَتْ</foreign>:]) and <foreign lang="ar">أَمِنَتِ العِثَارَ وَالإَعْيَآءٍ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">She was secure from,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">free from fear of, stumbling, and becoming jaded</hi>]: (M:) and <foreign lang="ar">أُمِنَ عِثَارُهَا</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">Her stumbling was not feared</hi>]. (So in a copy of the S.) And, of a highly-prized camel, <foreign lang="ar">أُمِنَ أَنْ يُنْحَرَ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">It was not feared that he would be slaughtered;</hi> or <hi rend="ital">his being slaughtered was not feared</hi>]. (M.) [<foreign lang="ar">أَمنَهُ</foreign> sometimes means <hi rend="ital">He was,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">became, free from fear, though having cause for fear, of him,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">it.</hi> i. e. <hi rend="ital">he thought himself secure,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">safe, from him</hi> or <hi rend="ital">it.</hi> (See Kur vii. 97.)]          <sense type="b" n="2">-b2-</sense>  <foreign lang="ar">أمِنَهُ</foreign> (inf. n. <foreign lang="ar">أَمْنٌ</foreign> TK) [and accord. to some copies of the K   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n1255-1" target="آمَنَهُ" n="1" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar"/></foreign>] and   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n1255-2" target="أمّنهُ" n="2" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n1256"/></foreign> (inf. n. <foreign lang="ar">تَأْمِينٌ</foreign> K) and   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n1255-3" target="ائتمنهُ" n="3" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar"/></foreign> ([written with the disjunctive alif <foreign lang="ar">اِيتَمَنَهُ</foreign>, and] also written <foreign lang="ar">اِتَّمَنَهُ</foreign>, on the authority of Th, which is extr., like <foreign lang="ar">اِتَّهَلَ</foreign> [&amp;c.], M) and   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n1255-4" target="استأمنهُ" n="4" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n1258"/></foreign> all signify the same (M, K, TA) [<hi rend="ital">He trusted,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">confided, in him;</hi> (as also <foreign lang="ar">آمن بِهِ</foreign>, q. v.;) <hi rend="ital">he intrusted him with,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">confided to him, power, authority, control,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">a charge; he gave him charge</hi> over a thing or person: these meanings are vaguely indicated in the M and K and TA.]. You say, <foreign lang="ar">يَأْمَنُهُ النَّاسُ وَلَا يَخَافُونَ غَائِلَتَهُ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">Men,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">people, trust,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">confide, in him, and do not fear his malevolence,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mischievousness</hi>]. (T, M.) And <foreign lang="ar">أَمِنَهُ عَلَى كَذَا</foreign> (S, Mgh, * Msb *) and   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n1255-5" target="ائتمنهُ" n="5" lang="ar" type="7" subtype="WOTF"/> عَلَيْهِ</foreign>, (S, Msb, K,) [<hi rend="ital">He trusted,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">confided, in him with respect to such a thing; he intrusted him with,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">confided to him, power, authority, control,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">a charge, over it; he gave him charge over it;</hi>] <hi rend="ital">he made him,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">took him as,</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">أَمِين</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">over such a thing.</hi> (Mgh.) Hence, in a trad., the <foreign lang="ar">مُؤَذِّن</foreign> is said to be <foreign lang="ar">مُؤْتَمَنٌ</foreign>; i. e. <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n1255-6" target="يَأْتَمِنُهُ" n="6" type="5" subtype="FSO" lang="ar"/>النَّاسُ عَلَ الأَوْقَاتِ الَّتِى يُؤَذَّنُ فِيهَا</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">Men trust,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">confide, in him with respect to the times in which he calls to prayer</hi>], and know, by his calling to prayer, what they are commanded to do, as to praying and fasting and breaking fast. (Mgh.) It is said in the Kur [xii. 11], <foreign lang="ar">مَا لَكَ</foreign> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">لَا تَأْمَنُنَا عَلَى يُوسُفَ</foreign> and [<foreign lang="ar">تَأْمَنَّا</foreign>] with idghám [i. e. <hi rend="ital">What aileth thee that thou dost not trust,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">confide, in us with respect to Joseph?</hi> or, <hi rend="ital">that thou dost not give us charge over Joseph?</hi>]; (S;) meaning, why dost thou fear us for him? (Bd;) some pronouncing the verb in a manner between those of the former and the latter modes of writing it; but Akh says that the latter is better: (S:) some read <foreign lang="ar">تِيمَنَّا</foreign>. (Bd.) You say also,   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n1255-7" target="اُوتُمِنَ" n="7" lang="ar" type="7" subtype="WOTF"/> فُلَانٌ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">Such a one was trusted,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">confided, in</hi> &amp;c.;] when it begins a sentence, changing the second <foreign lang="ar">ء</foreign> into <foreign lang="ar">و</foreign>; in like manner as you change it into <foreign lang="ar">ى</foreign> when the first is with kesr, as in <foreign lang="ar">اِيتَمَنَهُ</foreign>; and into <foreign lang="ar">ا</foreign> when the first is with fet-h, as in <foreign lang="ar">آمَنَ</foreign>. (S.) The phrase <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n1255-8" target="اُوتُمِنَ" n="8" type="5" subtype="FSO" lang="ar"/>أَمَانَةً</foreign>, in a saying of Mohammad, if it be not correctly <foreign lang="ar">عَلَى أَمَانَةٍ</foreign>, may be explained as implying the meaning of <foreign lang="ar">اُسْتُحْفِظَ أَمَانَةً</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">He was asked to take care of a deposite;</hi> or <hi rend="ital">he was intrusted with it</hi>]. (Mgh.) [You also say, <foreign lang="ar">أَمِنَهُ بِكَذَا</foreign>, meaning <hi rend="ital">He intrusted him with such a thing;</hi> as, for instance, money or other property: see two exs. in the Kur iii. 68.]       <sense type="A" n="2">-A2-</sense>  <foreign lang="ar">أَمُنَ</foreign>, (M, Mgh, K,) or <foreign lang="ar">أَمِنَ</foreign>, (Msb,) inf. n. <foreign lang="ar">أَمَانَةٌ</foreign>, (M, Mgh, Msb,) <hi rend="ital">He was,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">became, trusted in,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">confided in:</hi> (M, K:) or <hi rend="ital">he was,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">became, trusty, trustworthy, trustful, confidential,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">faithful:</hi> said of a man. (Mgh.)    </entryFree>27:T1ef7,<entryFree id="n1257" key="آمَنَ" type="main">     
                  <form>       
                     <itype>4</itype>        
                     <orth orig="" extent="full" lang="ar">آمَنَ</orth>
                     <orth extent="full" lang="ar">آمن</orth>
                  </form> is originally <foreign lang="ar">أَأْمَنَ</foreign>; the second <foreign lang="ar">ء</foreign> being softened. (S.) You say, <foreign lang="ar">آمنهُ</foreign>, [inf. n. <foreign lang="ar">إِيمَانٌ</foreign>;] (S, M, Msb;) and   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n1257-1" target="أمّنهُ" n="1" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n1256"/></foreign>, [inf. n. <foreign lang="ar">تَأْمِينٌ</foreign>;] (M, TA;) meaning <hi rend="ital">He rendered him secure,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">safe;</hi> (Msb;) <hi rend="ital">he rendered him secure,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">free from fear;</hi> (S, M, TA;) <hi rend="ital">contr. of</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">أَخَافهُ</foreign>: (TA:) so in <foreign lang="ar">آمَنْتُهُ مِنْهُ</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">I rendered him secure,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">safe, from him,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">it.</hi> (Msb.) And of God you say, <foreign lang="ar">آمَنَ عِبادَهُ مِنْ أَنْ يَظْلِمَهُمْ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">He hath rendered his servants secure from his wronging them</hi>]. (S.) And <foreign lang="ar">يُؤْمِنُ عِبَادَهُ مِنْ عَذَابِهِ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">He rendereth his servants secure from his punishment</hi>]. (M.) You say also, <foreign lang="ar">آمَنْتُ الأَسِيرَ</foreign>, meaning <hi rend="ital">I gave,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">granted,</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">الأَمَان</foreign> [i. e. <hi rend="ital">security</hi> or <hi rend="ital">safety,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">protection</hi> or <hi rend="ital">safeguard,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">the promise</hi> or <hi rend="ital">assurance of security</hi> or <hi rend="ital">safety,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">indemnity,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">quarter,</hi>] <hi rend="ital">to the captive.</hi> (Msb.) And <foreign lang="ar">آمَنَ فُلَانٌ الَعَدُوَّ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">Such a one granted security,</hi> &amp;c., <hi rend="ital">to the enemy</hi>], inf. n. as above. (T.) It is said in the Kur ch. ix. [verse 12], accord. to one reading, <foreign lang="ar">لَا إِيمَانَ لَهُمْ</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">They have not the attribute of granting protection;</hi> meaning that when they grant protection, they do not fulfil their engagement to protect. (T.)       <sense type="A" n="2">-A2-</sense>  <foreign lang="ar">إِيمَانٌ</foreign> also signifies The <hi rend="ital">believing</hi> [a thing, or in a thing, and particularly in God]; syn. <foreign lang="ar">تَصْدِيقٌ</foreign>; (T, S, &amp;c.;) by common consent of the lexicologists and other men of science: (T:) its primary meaning is the <hi rend="ital">becoming true to the trust with respect to which God has confided in one, by a firm believing with the heart; not by profession of belief with the tongue only, without the assent of the heart;</hi> for he who does not firmly believe with his heart is either a hypocrite or an ignorant person. (T, TA.) Its verb is intrans. and trans. (TA, from a Commentary on the Mutowwal.) You say, <foreign lang="ar">آمَنَ</foreign>, meaning <hi rend="ital">He believed.</hi> (T.) And it is said to be trans. by itself, like <foreign lang="ar">صَدَّقَ</foreign>; and by means of <foreign lang="ar">بِ</foreign>, considered as meaning <foreign lang="ar">اِعْتِرَافٌ</foreign> [or <hi rend="ital">acknowledgment</hi>]; and by means of <foreign lang="ar">لِ</foreign>, considered as meaning <foreign lang="ar">إِذْعَانٌ</foreign> [or <hi rend="ital">submission</hi>]. (TA.) [Thus] you say, [<foreign lang="ar">آمنهُ</foreign> and] <foreign lang="ar">آمن بِهِ</foreign>, (inf. n. <foreign lang="ar">إِيمَانٌ</foreign>, T, K,) namely, a thing. (T, M.) And <foreign lang="ar">آمن بِاللّٰهِ</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">He believed in God.</hi> (T.) It seems to be meant by what is said in the Ksh [in ii. 2], that <foreign lang="ar">آمن بِهِ</foreign> [or <foreign lang="ar">آمَنَهُ</foreign>] properly signifies <foreign lang="ar">آمَنَهُ التَّكْذِيبَ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">He rendered him secure from being charged with lying,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">falsehood</hi>]; and that the meaning <hi rend="ital">he believed him</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in him,</hi> is tropical; but this is at variance with what its author says in the A; and Es-Saad says that this latter meaning is proper. (TA.)  <pb n="101"/> The phrase in the Kur [ix. 61], <foreign lang="ar">وَيُؤْمِنُ لِلْمؤْمِنِينَ</foreign>, accord. to Th, means <hi rend="ital">And he believeth the believers; giveth credit to them.</hi> (M.)          <sense type="b" n="2">-b2-</sense>  Sometimes it is employed to signify The <hi rend="ital">acknowledging with the tongue</hi> only; and hence, in the Kur [lxiii. 3], <foreign lang="ar">ذلِكَ بأَنَّهُمْ آمَنُوا ثُمَّ كَفَرُوا</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">That is because they acknowledged with the tongue, then disacknowledged with the heart.</hi> (TA.)          <sense type="b" n="3">-b3-</sense>  Also <assumedtropical>(assumed tropical:)</assumedtropical>  The <hi rend="ital">trusting,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">confiding,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">having trust</hi> or <hi rend="ital">confidence.</hi> (M, K.) [You say, <foreign lang="ar">آمن بِهِ</foreign>, meaning <hi rend="ital">He trusted,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">confided, in him,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">it:</hi> for] the verb of <foreign lang="ar">ايمان</foreign> in this sense is trans. by means of <foreign lang="ar">بِ</foreign> without implication; as Bd says. (TA.) [And it is also trans. by itself: for] you say, <foreign lang="ar">مَا آمَنَ أَنْ يَجِدَ صَحَابَةً</foreign>, meaning <tropical>(tropical:)</tropical>  <hi rend="ital">He trusted not that he would find companions;</hi> (M, * K, * TA;) said of one who has formed the intention of journeying: or the meaning is <foreign lang="ar">مَا كَادَ</foreign> [i. e. <hi rend="ital">he hardly,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">scarcely, found</hi> &amp;c.; or <hi rend="ital">he was not near to finding</hi> &amp;c.]. (M, K.) See also <foreign lang="ar">أَمِنَهُ</foreign>.          <sense type="b" n="4">-b4-</sense>  Also The <hi rend="ital">manifesting humility</hi> or <hi rend="ital">submission, and the accepting the Law,</hi> (Zj, T, * K,) <hi rend="ital">and that which the Prophet has said</hi> or <hi rend="ital">done, and the firm believing thereof with the heart;</hi> (Zj, T, M;) without which firm belief, the manifesting of humility or submission, and the accepting that which the Prophet has said or done, is termed <foreign lang="ar">إِسْلَامٌ</foreign>, for which one's blood is to be spared. (T.) [In this sense, it is trans. by means of <foreign lang="ar">لِ</foreign>, accord. to some, as shown above; or by means of <foreign lang="ar">بِ</foreign>, for, accord. to Fei,] you say, <foreign lang="ar">آمَنْتُ بِاللّٰهِ</foreign>, inf. n. as above, meaning <hi rend="ital">I submitted,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">resigned, myself to God.</hi> (Msb.) [There are numerous other explanations which it is needless to give, differing according to different persuasions.          <sense type="b" n="5">-b5-</sense>  See also <foreign lang="ar">إِيمَان</foreign> below.]    </entryFree>28:T4da,<entryFree id="n1258" key="استأمنهُ" type="main">

                  <form>       
                     <orth orig="" extent="full" lang="ar">أَمُونٌ</orth>
                     <orth extent="full" lang="ar">ذ</orth>
                  </form>, applied to a she camel, of the measure <foreign lang="ar">فَعُولٌ</foreign> in the sense of the measure <foreign lang="ar">مَفْعُولَةٌ</foreign>, like <foreign lang="ar">عَصُوبٌ</foreign> and <foreign lang="ar">حَلُوبٌ</foreign>, <tropical>(tropical:)</tropical>  <hi rend="ital">Trusted,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">confided, in;</hi> (T;) <hi rend="ital">firmly, compactly,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">strongly, made;</hi> (T, S, M, K;) <hi rend="ital">secure from,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">free from fear of, being weak:</hi> (S, M:) also, that is <hi rend="ital">secure from,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">free from fear of, stumbling, and becoming jaded:</hi> (M:) or <hi rend="ital">strong, so that her becoming languid is not feared:</hi> (A, TA:) pl. <foreign lang="ar">أُمُنٌ</foreign>. (M, K.) [See also what next follows.]    </entryFree>2c:T1bcb,<entryFree id="n1268" key="أَمينٌ" type="main">     
                  <form>       
                     <orth orig="" extent="full" lang="ar">أَمينٌ</orth>
                     <orth extent="full" lang="ar">ذ</orth>
                  </form> 
                  <hi rend="ital">Trusted; trusted in; confided in;</hi> (T, * S, * M, Msb, * K;) as also   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n1268-1" target="أُمَّانٌ" n="1" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n1271"/></foreign>; (S, M, K;) <hi rend="ital">i. q.</hi>   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n1268-2" target="مَأْمُونٌ" n="2" type="1" subtype="SO" lang="ar" select="n1278"/></foreign> (S, M, K) and   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n1268-3" target="مُؤْتَمَنٌ" n="3" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n1280"/></foreign>: (ISk, T, K:) [<hi rend="ital">a person in whom one trusts</hi> or <hi rend="ital">confides; a confidant; a person intrusted with,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">to whom is confided, power, authority, control,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">a charge,</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">عَلَى شَىْءٍ</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">over a thing; a person intrusted with an affair,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">with affairs,</hi> i. e., <hi rend="ital">with the management,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">disposal, thereof; a confidential agent,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">superintendent; a commissioner; a commissary; a trustee; a depositary;</hi>] <hi rend="ital">a guardian:</hi> (TA:) <hi rend="ital">trusty; trustworthy; trustful; confidential; faithful:</hi> (Mgh, Msb: *) pl. <foreign lang="ar">أُمَنَآءُ</foreign>, and, accord. to some,   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n1268-4" target="أَمَنَةٌ" n="4" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar"/></foreign>, as in a trad. in which it is said, <foreign lang="ar">أَصْحَابِى أَمَنَةٌ لِأُمَّتِى</foreign>, meaning <hi rend="ital">My companions are guardians to my people:</hi> or, accord. to others, this is pl. of   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n1268-5" target="آمِنٌ" n="5" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n1272"/></foreign> [app. in a sense mentioned below in this paragraph, so that the meaning in this trad. is <hi rend="ital">my companions are persons who accord trust,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">confidence, to my people</hi>]. (TA.) Hence, <quote>
                     <L>
                        <foreign lang="ar">أَلَمْ تَعْلَمِى يَا أَسْمَ وَيْحَكِ أَنَّنِى</foreign>
                     </L> 
                     <L>
                        <foreign lang="ar">حَلَفْتُ يَمِينًا لَا أَخُونُ أَمِينِى</foreign>
                     </L> 
                  </quote> [<hi rend="ital">Knowest thou not, O Asmà</hi> (<foreign lang="ar">أَسْمَآء</foreign>, curtailed for the sake of the metre), <hi rend="ital">mercy on thee!</hi> or <hi rend="ital">woe to thee! that I have sworn an oath that I will not act treacherously to him in whom I trust?</hi>] i. e.   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n1268-6" target="مَأْمُونِى" n="6" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar"/></foreign>: (S:) or the meaning here is, <hi rend="ital">him who trusts,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">confides, in me;</hi> (ISk, T;) [i. e.] it is here <hi rend="ital">syn. with</hi>   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n1268-7" target="آمِنِى" n="7" type="1" subtype="SO" lang="ar"/></foreign>. (M.) [Hence also,] <foreign lang="ar">الأَمِينُ فِى القِمَارِ</foreign>, (K voce <foreign lang="ar">مُجُمِدٌ</foreign>, &amp;c.,) or <foreign lang="ar">أَمِينُ</foreign>, <foreign lang="ar">القِمَارِ</foreign>, [<hi rend="ital">The person who is intrusted, as deputy, with the disposal of the arrows in the game called</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">المَيْسِر</foreign>; or] <hi rend="ital">he who shuffles the arrows;</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">الَّذِى</foreign>. <foreign lang="ar">يَضْرِبُ بِالقِدَاحِ</foreign>. (EM p. 105.) [Hence also,] <foreign lang="ar">الرُّوحُ الأَمِينُ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">The Trusted,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Trusty, Spirit</hi>]; (Kur xxvi. 193;) applied to Gabriel, because he is intrusted with the revelation of God. (Bd.)   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n1268-8" target="أُمَّانٌ" n="8" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n1271"/></foreign>, mentioned above, and occurring in a verse of El-Aashà, applied to a merchant, is said by some to mean <hi rend="ital">Possessed of religion and excellence.</hi> (M.)   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n1268-9" target="مُؤْتَمَنٌ" n="9" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n1280"/></foreign> is applied, in a trad., to the <foreign lang="ar">مُؤَذِّن</foreign>, as meaning that men trust, or confide, in him with respect to the times in which he calls to prayer, and know by his call what they are commanded to do as to praying and fasting and breaking fast. (Mgh.) <foreign lang="ar">هُوَ <ref cref="n1268-10" target="مَأْمُونُ" n="10" type="5" subtype="FSO" lang="ar"/>المُعَامَلَةِ</foreign> means <hi rend="ital">He is</hi> [<hi rend="ital">trusty,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">trustworthy, in dealing with others;</hi> or] <hi rend="ital">free from exorbitance and deceit</hi> or <hi rend="ital">artifice</hi> or <hi rend="ital">craft to be feared.</hi> (Msb.)          <sense type="b" n="2">-b2-</sense>  <hi rend="ital">An aid,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">assistant;</hi> syn. <foreign lang="ar">عَوْنٌ</foreign> [here app. meaning, as it often does, <hi rend="ital">an armed attendant,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">a guard</hi>]; because one trusts in his strength, and is without fear of his being weak. (M.)          <sense type="b" n="3">-b3-</sense>  <assumedtropical>(assumed tropical:)</assumedtropical>  The <hi rend="ital">strong;</hi> syn. <foreign lang="ar">قَوِىٌّ</foreign>. (K, TA: [in the latter of which is given the same reason for this signification as is given in the M for that of <foreign lang="ar">عون</foreign>; for which <foreign lang="ar">قوى</foreign> may be a mistranscription; but see <foreign lang="ar">أَمُونٌ</foreign>.])          <sense type="b" n="4">-b4-</sense>  One <hi rend="ital">who trusts,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">confides, in</hi> another; (ISk, T, K;) [as also   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n1268-11" target="آمِنٌ" n="11" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n1272"/></foreign>, of which see an ex. voce <foreign lang="ar">حَذِرٌ</foreign>;] so accord. to ISk in the verse cited above in this paragraph: (T:) thus it bears two contr. significations. (K.)          <sense type="b" n="5">-b5-</sense>  See also <foreign lang="ar">آمِنٌ</foreign>, in five places.       <sense type="A" n="2">-A2-</sense>  And see <foreign lang="ar">آمِينَ</foreign>. <pb n="102"/>    
               </entryFree>2d:T1abb,<entryFree id="n1270" key="أَمَانَةٌ" type="main">     
                  <form>       
                     <orth orig="" extent="full" lang="ar">أَمَانَةٌ</orth>
                     <orth extent="full" lang="ar">ذ</orth>
                  </form>: see <foreign lang="ar">أَمْنٌ</foreign>, first sentence.          <sense type="b" n="2">-b2-</sense>  <hi rend="ital">Trustiness; trustworthiness; trustfulness; faithfulness; fidelity;</hi> (M, Mgh, K;) as also   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n1270-1" target="أَمَنَةٌ" n="1" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar"/></foreign>. (M, K.) <foreign lang="ar">أَمَانَةُ اللّٰهِ</foreign> [for <foreign lang="ar">أَمَانَةُ اللّٰهِ قَسَمِي</foreign> or <foreign lang="ar">مَا أُقْسِمُ</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">The faithfulness of God is my oath</hi> or <hi rend="ital">that by which I swear</hi>] is composed of an inf. n. prefixed to the agent, and the former is in the nom. case as an inchoative; the phrase being like <foreign lang="ar">لَعَمْرُ اللّٰهِ</foreign>, as meaning an oath; and the enunciative being suppressed, and meant to be understood: accord. to some, you say, <foreign lang="ar">أَمَانَةَ اللّٰهِ</foreign> [app. for <foreign lang="ar">نَشَدْتُكَ أَمَانَةَ اللّٰهِ</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">I adjure thee,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">conjure thee, by the faithfulness of God,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">the like</hi>], making it to be governed in the accus. case by the verb which is to be understood: and some correctly say, <foreign lang="ar">وَأَمَانَةِ اللّٰهِ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">By the faithfulness of God</hi>], with the <foreign lang="ar">و</foreign> which denotes an oath: (Mgh:) or this last is an oath accord. to Aboo-Haneefeh; but Esh-Sháfi'ee does not reckon it as such: and it is forbidden in a trad. to swear by <foreign lang="ar">الأَمَانَة</foreign>; app. because it is not one of the names of God. (TA.) [Or these phrases may have been used, in the manner of an oath, agreeably with explanations here following.]       <sense type="A" n="2">-A2-</sense>  <hi rend="ital">A thing committed to the trust and care of a person; a trust; a deposite;</hi> (Mgh, Msb;) and <hi rend="ital">the like:</hi> (Msb:) <hi rend="ital">property committed to trust and care:</hi> (TA:) pl. <foreign lang="ar">أَمَانَاتٌ</foreign>. (Mgh, Msb.) It is said in the Kur [viii. 27], <foreign lang="ar">وَتَخُونُوا أَمَانَاتِكُمْ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">Nor be ye unfaithful to the trusts committed to you</hi>]. (Mgh.) And in the same [xxxiii. 72], <foreign lang="ar">إِنَّا عَرَضْنَاالأَمَانَةَ عَلَى</foreign> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">السّموَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِوَالْجِبَالِ فَأَبَيْنَ أَنْ يَحْمِلْنَهَا وَأَشْفَقْنَ</foreign> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">مِنْهَا وَحَمَلَهَا الْإِنْسَانُ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">Verily we proposed,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">offered, the trust</hi> which we have committed to man <hi rend="ital">to the heavens and the earth and the mountains, and</hi> (accord. to explanations of Bd and others) <hi rend="ital">they refused to take it upon themselves,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">to accept it, and they feared it, but man took it upon himself,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">accepted it:</hi> or, (accord. to another explanation of Bd, also given in the T, and in the K in art. <foreign lang="ar">حمل</foreign>, &amp;c.,) <hi rend="ital">they refused to be unfaithful to it, and they feared it, but man was unfaithful to it:</hi> but in explaining what this trust was, authors greatly differ: accord. to some,] <foreign lang="ar">الامانة</foreign> here means <hi rend="ital">obedience;</hi> so called because the rendering thereof is incumbent: or <hi rend="ital">the obedience which includes that which is natural and that which depends upon the will:</hi> [for] it is said that when God created these [celestial and terrestrial] bodies, He created in them understanding: or it may here [and in some other instances] mean <hi rend="ital">reason,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">intellect:</hi> [and <hi rend="ital">the faculty of volition:</hi> and app. <hi rend="ital">conscience:</hi> these being trusts committed to us by God, to be faithfully employed: (see an ex. voce <foreign lang="ar">جَذْرٌ</foreign>:)] and <hi rend="ital">the imposition of a task</hi> or <hi rend="ital">duty</hi> or <hi rend="ital">of tasks</hi> or <hi rend="ital">duties</hi> [app. <hi rend="ital">combined with reason</hi> or <hi rend="ital">intellect, which is necessary for the performance thereof</hi>]: (Bd:) or it here means <hi rend="ital">prayers and other duties for the performance of which there is recompense and for the neglect of which there is punishment:</hi> (Jel:) or, accord. to I'Ab and Sa'eed Ibn-Jubeyr, (T,) <hi rend="ital">the obligatory statutes which God has imposed upon his servants:</hi> (T, K: *) or, (T, K,) accord. to Ibn-'Omar, [<hi rend="ital">the choice between</hi>] <hi rend="ital">obedience and disobedience</hi> was offered to Adam, and he was informed of the recompense of obedience and the punishment of disobedience: but, in my opinion, he says, (T,) it here means <hi rend="ital">the intention which one holds in the heart,</hi> (T, K,) <hi rend="ital">with respect to the belief which he professes with the tongue, and with respect to all the obligatory statutes which he externally fulfils;</hi> (K;) because God has confided to him power over it, and not manifested it to any [other] of his creatures, so that he who conceives in his mind, with respect to the acknowledgment of the unity of God, (T, K,) and with respect to belief [in general], (T,) the like of that which he professes, he fulfils the <foreign lang="ar">امانة</foreign> [or trust], (T, K,) and he who conceives in his mind disbelief while he professes belief with the tongue is unfaithful thereto, and every one who is unfaithful to that which is confided to him is [termed] <foreign lang="ar">حَامِلٌ</foreign>, (T,) or <foreign lang="ar">حَامِلُ</foreign> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">الأَمَانَةِ</foreign>, and <foreign lang="ar">مُحْتَمِلُهَا</foreign>: (Bd:) and by <foreign lang="ar">الإِنْسَانُ</foreign> is here meant the doubting disbeliever. (T.)          <sense type="b" n="2">-b2-</sense>  Also, [as being a trust committed to him by God, A man's] <hi rend="ital">family,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">household;</hi> syn. <foreign lang="ar">أَهْلٌ</foreign>. (TA.)    </entryFree>2e:T503,<entryFree id="n1271" key="أُمَّانٌ" type="main">

                     <orth orig="" extent="full" lang="ar">أُمَّانٌ</orth>

(K, TA.) [But this belongs to art. <foreign lang="ar">ام</foreign>; being of the measure <foreign lang="ar">فُعْلَانٌ</foreign>, like <foreign lang="ar">عُرْيَانٌ</foreign>.]          <sense type="b" n="2">-b2-</sense>  And <hi rend="ital">A sower,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cultivator of land;</hi> [perhaps meaning <hi rend="ital">a clown,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">boor;</hi>] syn. <foreign lang="ar">زَرَّاعٌ</foreign>: (CK:) or <hi rend="ital">sowers,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cultivators of land;</hi> syn. <foreign lang="ar">زُرَّاعٌ</foreign>: (K, TA:) in one copy of the K <foreign lang="ar">زِرَاع</foreign>. (TA.)    </entryFree>2f:T1006,<entryFree id="n1272" key="آمِنٌ" type="main">     
                  <form>       
                     <orth orig="" extent="full" lang="ar">آمِنٌ</orth>
                     <orth extent="full" lang="ar">آمن</orth>
                  </form> 
                  <hi rend="ital">Secure, safe,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">free from fear;</hi> as also   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n1272-1" target="أَمِينٌ" n="1" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar"/></foreign> (Lh, T, * S, * M, Msb, K) and   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n1272-2" target="أَمِنٌ" n="2" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n1262"/></foreign>. (M, K.) Hence, in the Kur [xcv. 3],   
      <foreign lang="ar">وَهذَا الْبَلَدِ <ref cref="n1272-3" target="الْأَمِينِ" n="3" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar"/></foreign> [<hi rend="ital">And this secure town</hi>]; (Akh, Lh, T, S, M;) meaning Mekkeh. (M.) <foreign lang="ar">بَلَدٌ آمِنٌ</foreign> and   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n1272-4" target="أَمِينٌ" n="4" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar"/></foreign> means <hi rend="ital">A town,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">country,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">district, of which the inhabitants are in a state of security,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">confidence, therein.</hi> (Msb.) It is also said in the Kur [xliv. 51],   
      <foreign lang="ar">إِنَّ الْمُتَّقِينَ فِي مَقَامٍ <ref cref="n1272-5" target="أَمِينٍ" n="5" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar"/></foreign>, meaning [<hi rend="ital">Verily the pious</hi> shall be <hi rend="ital">in an abode</hi>] <hi rend="ital">wherein they shall be secure from the accidents,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">casualties, of fortune.</hi> (M.) [And hence,]   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n1272-6" target="الأَمِينُ" n="6" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar"/></foreign> is one of the epithets applied to God, (Mgh, K,) on the authority of El-Hasan; (Mgh;) an assertion requiring consideration: it may mean <hi rend="ital">He who is secure with respect to the accidents,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">casualties, of fortune:</hi> but see <foreign lang="ar">المُؤْمِنُ</foreign>, which is [well known as] an epithet applied to God. (TA.) <foreign lang="ar">آمِنُ المَالِ</foreign> means <hi rend="ital">What is secure from being slaughtered, of the camels, because of its being highly prized;</hi> by <foreign lang="ar">المال</foreign> being meant <foreign lang="ar">الإِبِل</foreign>: or, as some say, <tropical>(tropical:)</tropical>  <hi rend="ital">what is highly esteemed, of property</hi> of any kind; as though, if it had intellect, it would feel secure from being exchanged. (M.) You say, <foreign lang="ar">أَعْطَيْتُهُ مِنْ آمِنِ مَالِي</foreign>, (K, TA, [in the CK <foreign lang="ar">آمَنِ</foreign>,]) meaning <tropical>(tropical:)</tropical>  <hi rend="ital">I gave him of the choice,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">best, of my property; of what was highly esteemed thereof;</hi> (K, TA;) and <foreign lang="ar">مِنْ <ref cref="n1272-7" target="أَمْنِ" n="7" type="5" subtype="FSO" lang="ar"/>مَالِى</foreign> which Az explains as meaning <hi rend="ital">of the choice,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">best, of my property.</hi> (TA: [in which is given a verse cited by ISk showing that <foreign lang="ar">أَمْن</foreign>, thus used, is not a mistranscription for <foreign lang="ar">آمِن</foreign>.]) And <foreign lang="ar">آمِنُ الحِلْمِ</foreign> means <hi rend="ital">Steadfast in forbearance</hi> or <hi rend="ital">clemency; of whose becoming disordered in temper, and free from self-restraint, there is no fear.</hi> (M.)          <sense type="b" n="2">-b2-</sense>  See also <foreign lang="ar">أَمِينٌ</foreign>, in three places:          <sense type="b" n="3">-b3-</sense>  and see <foreign lang="ar">اَمِنٌ</foreign>.       <sense type="A" n="2">-A2-</sense>  See also <foreign lang="ar">أَمِينٌ</foreign>, in two places.    </entryFree>30:Teb5,<entryFree id="n1273" key="آمِينَ" type="main">     
                  <form>       
                     <orth orig="" extent="full" lang="ar">آمِينَ</orth>
                     <orth extent="full" lang="ar">آمين</orth>
                  </form> [in the CK, erroneously, <foreign lang="ar">آمِينُ</foreign>] and   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n1273-1" target="أَمِينَ" n="1" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar"/></foreign>; (Th, T, S, M, Mgh, Msb, K;) both chaste and well known, (TA,) the latter of the dial. of El-Hijáz, (Msb, TA,) as some say, (TA,) [and this, though the less common, is the original form, for] the medd in the former is only to give fulness of sound to the fet-hah of the <foreign lang="ar">أ</foreign>, (Th, M, Msb, TA,) as is shown by the fact that there is no word in the Arabic language of the measure <foreign lang="ar">فَاعِيلٌ</foreign>; (Msb, TA;) and some pronounce the former <foreign lang="ar">آمِّينَ</foreign>, (K,) which is said by some of the learned to be a dial. var., (Msb,) but this is a mistake, (S, Msb,) accord. to authorities of good repute, and is one of old date, originating from an assertion of Ahmad Ibn-Yahyà, [i. e. Th,] that <foreign lang="ar">آمِينَ</foreign> is like <foreign lang="ar">عَاصِينَ</foreign>, by which he was falsely supposed to mean its having the form of a pl., [and being consequently <foreign lang="ar">آمِّينَ</foreign>,] (Msb, [and part of this is said in the M,]) whereas he thereby only meant that the <foreign lang="ar">م</foreign> is without teshdeed, like the <foreign lang="ar">ص</foreign> in <foreign lang="ar">عَاصِينَ</foreign>; (M;) beside that the sense of <foreign lang="ar">قَاصِدِينَ</foreign> [which is that of <foreign lang="ar">آمِّينَ</foreign>, from <foreign lang="ar">أَمَّ</foreign>,] would be inconsistent after the last phrase of the first chapter of the Kur [where <foreign lang="ar">آمينَ</foreign> is usually added]; (Msb;) and sometimes it is pronounced with imáleh, [i. e. “émeena,”] as is said by ElWáhidee in the Beseet; (K;) but this is unknown in works on lexicology, and is said to be a mispronunciation of some of the Arabs of the desert of El-Yemen: (MF:) each form is indecl., (S,) with fet-h for its termination, like <foreign lang="ar">أَيْنَ</foreign> and <foreign lang="ar">كَيْفَ</foreign>, to prevent the occurrence of two quiescent letters together: (T, S, TA:) it is a word used immediately after a prayer, or supplication: (S, * M:) [it is best expressed, when occurring in a translation, by the familiar Hebrew equivalent <hi rend="ital">Amen:</hi>] El-Fárisee says that it is a compound of a verb and a noun; (M;) meaning <hi rend="ital">answer Thou me;</hi> [i. e. <hi rend="ital">answer Thou my prayer;</hi>] (M, Mgh;*) or <hi rend="ital">O God, answer Thou:</hi> (Zj, T, Msb, K:) or <hi rend="ital">so be it:</hi> (AHát, S, Msb, K:) or <hi rend="ital">so do Thou,</hi> (K, TA,) <hi rend="ital">O Lord:</hi> (TA:) it is strangely asserted by some of the learned, that, after the Fátihah, [or Opening Chapter of the Kur-án,] it is a prayer which implies all that is prayed for in detail in the Fátihah: so in the Towsheeh: (MF:) or it is <hi rend="ital">one of the names of God:</hi> (M, Msb, K:) so says El-Hasan (M, Msb) El-Basree: (Msb:) but the assertion that it is for <foreign lang="ar">يَا اَللّٰهُ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">O God</hi>], and that <foreign lang="ar">اسْتَجِبٌ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">answer Thou</hi>] is meant to be understood, is not correct accord. to the lexicologists; for, were it so, it would be with refa, not nasb. (T.)    </entryFree>31:T5ba,<entryFree id="n1274" key="إِيمَانٌ" type="main">     
                  <form>       
                     <orth orig="" extent="full" lang="ar">إِيمَانٌ</orth>
                     <orth extent="full" lang="ar">أيم</orth>
                     <orth extent="full" lang="ar">أيمان</orth>
                     <orth extent="full" lang="ar">إيمان</orth>
                     <orth extent="full" lang="ar">ايمان</orth>
                     <orth extent="full" lang="ar">يمين</orth>
                  </form> [inf. n. of 4, q. v.          <sense type="b" n="2">-b2-</sense>  Used as a simple subst., <hi rend="ital">Belief;</hi> particularly <hi rend="ital">in God, and in his word and apostles &amp;c.: faith: trust,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">confidence:</hi> &amp;c.]          <sense type="b" n="3">-b3-</sense>  Sometimes it means <hi rend="ital">Prayer;</hi> syn. <foreign lang="ar">صَلَاةٌ</foreign>: as in the Kur [ii. 138], where it is said, <foreign lang="ar">وَمَا كَانَ اللّٰهُ لِيُضِيعَ إِيَمانَكُمْ</foreign>, (Bd, Jel, TA,) i. e. [<hi rend="ital">God will not make to be lost</hi>] <hi rend="ital">your prayer</hi> 
                  <pb n="103"/> towards Jerusalem, (Bd, * Jel,) as some explain it. (Bd.)          <sense type="b" n="4">-b4-</sense>  Sometimes, also, it is used as meaning <hi rend="ital">The law brought by the Prophet.</hi> (Er-Rághib, TA.)    </entryFree>32:T6f7,<entryFree id="n1277" key="مُؤْمِنٌ" type="main">     
                  <form>       
                     <orth orig="" extent="full" lang="ar">مُؤْمِنٌ</orth>
                     <orth extent="full" lang="ar">ذ</orth>
                  </form> [act. part. n. of 4; <hi rend="ital">Rendering secure,</hi> &amp;c.]. <foreign lang="ar">المُؤْمِنُ</foreign> is an epithet applied to God; meaning <hi rend="ital">He who rendereth mankind secure from his wronging them:</hi> (T, S:) or <hi rend="ital">He who rendereth his servants secure from his punishment:</hi> (M, IAth:) <hi rend="ital">i. q.</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">المُهَيْمِنُ</foreign>, (M,) which is originally <foreign lang="ar">المُؤَأْمِنُ</foreign>; [for the form <foreign lang="ar">مُفْعِلٌ</foreign> is originally <foreign lang="ar">مُؤَفْعِلٌ</foreign>;] the second <foreign lang="ar">ء</foreign> being softened, and changed into <foreign lang="ar">ى</foreign>, and the first being changed into <foreign lang="ar">ه</foreign>: (S:) or <hi rend="ital">the Believer of his servants</hi> (Th, M, TA) <hi rend="ital">the Muslims, on the day of resurrection, when the nations shall be interrogated respecting the messages of their apostles:</hi> (TA:) or <hi rend="ital">He who will faithfully perform to his servants what He hath promised them:</hi> (T, TA:) or <hi rend="ital">He who hath declared in his word the truth of his unity.</hi> (T.)          <sense type="b" n="2">-b2-</sense>  [Also <hi rend="ital">Believing,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">a believer;</hi> particularly <hi rend="ital">in God, and in his word and apostles &amp;c.: faithful: trusting,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">confiding:</hi> &amp;c.: see 4.]
